p: Based on the high content of linolenic acid in flaxseed oil, which is about 50 times higher than olive and sesame oils (Table 1), addition of flaxseed oil to sesame and olive oil mixtures caused an effective decrease in ω6:ω3 ratio (Table 2), which is very important from nutritional prospective. Therefore, blending flaxseed oil with other vegetable oils which are low in ω3 fatty acid can change their fatty acid composition and increase ω3 fatty acid content. Samples containing 10% and 15% flaxseed have optimal levels of ω6:ω3 ratio as stated in the literature for better health achievement (Table 2).1
